thread.title: Amy Duggar Confesses the Devastating Truth About Her Childhood Abuse
thread.title_full: Amy Duggar Confesses the Devastating Truth About Her Childhood Abuse

title: Amy Duggar Confesses the Devastating Truth About Her Childhood Abuse
text:
Amy Duggar Confesses the Devastating Truth About Her Childhood Abuse Jenny Erikson 
amyrachelleking/Instagram We did not see this one coming. Amy Duggar finally confessed who physically abused her , and it is absolutely heartbreaking. On Friday night's episode of Marriage Boot Camp , we learned the sad truth that Amy was abused by her own father. 
The former 19 Kids and Counting star had fans in a tizzy earlier in the season, when a preview made it look as though she was saying her husband Dillon King had physically attacked her. She later clarified that it wasn't him, but a family member who had hurt her. 
More from CafeMom: Another Duggar May Be Headed Down the Aisle Soon 
Amy revealed that she was "scared s***less when she described how her father had abused her as a child. "My dad was like, 'Amy, did you brush your teeth?' And I was like, 'Yeah daddy.' And he was like, 'No you didn't.' And he picked me up by my throat, all the way up to the ceiling. He was like, 'You will brush your teeth,'" she revealed. 
She also revealed that she's "been called every name in the book," and that her dad tried to run her over with a car. She said, "It scared me half out of my mind." 
Um, yeah, it should have! No person should ever have to experience fear, pain, and trauma like that, especially from a parent. Parents are supposed to be our protectors when we're young, not a source of fear. 
More from CafeMom: Josiah Duggar's Ex-Girlfriend Might Be Getting Ready to Spill Family Secrets 
Amy still obviously has issues from it, as Dr. Venus Nicolino explained in the clip. "Amy's coping mechanism is to pretend that everything is always happy in her world. It's how she blocks out the trauma she faced in her childhood." 
Thankfully, she seems to have moved on since this episode was filmed. She told PEOPLE magazine last month that she had forgiven the man who had traumatized her. "It was a very heartfelt moment where I actually forgave that person who hurt me when I was younger," she explained. "I love the person very much and we're better now. But I did need to heal from that."
